dimensions.name: Emotional
dimensions.description: Bloomster's approach to education in the Emotional Dimension explores skills such as Self-Confidence, Self-Regulation, and Self-Discipline. From developing a strong sense of self to building awareness of their feelings, the development of emotional skills helps your student grow into an emotionally intelligent, balanced individual capable of navigating the uncertainties of life.

skills.name: Self-Regulation
skills.description: Bloomster's approach to Self-Regulation introduces your student to the concept of managing their impulses, as well as equipping your student with tools to help them feel that they are in control of their emotions rather than their emotions being in control of them. Your student gains valuable lessons in self-awareness & conflict resolution, and through self-regulation, they will become more mindful about the people and world around them.
skills.alert: How does your student handle challenging emotions in difficult situations? Would you say they respond or react?

activities.name: The Role of Communication in Impulse Control
Life In The Blue, Yellow, and Red Zone

skills.name: Self-Awareness
skills.description: Bloomster's approach to Self-Awareness teaches your student the power of reflection, recognizing their strengths, growth areas and what drives them. Self-Awareness is a building block for self-regulation, social & cultural awareness, and your student becoming a confident, multi-faceted individual capable of forging their future.
skills.alert: How well does your student respond to social cues? Do you feel that they know themselves?

activities.name: How Well Do We Know Ourselves?!
Not all goals can be winners...

skills.name: Self-Confidence
skills.description: Bloomster's approach to Self Confidence focuses on breaking down barriers hindering self-confidence, learning how failures make us stronger, celebrating individuality, and being assertive when needed. With awareness and tools in this foundational skill, your student will become a responsible, independent, and balanced adult capable of facing any challenge life brings.
skills.alert: In what ways has your student's education cultivated their self-confidence and belief in their unique potential?

activities.name: Self-Confidence is a problem for everyone

skills.name: Self-Discipline
skills.description: Bloomster’s approach to Self-Discipline offers your student the tools to regulate their emotions and behaviors through obstacles, and stay focused to achieve their goals – even in situations that may seem difficult or scary! This critical life skill empowers your student to independently overcome challenges, remain resilient and follow through in anything they pursue.
skills.alert: Is your student able to navigate challenges with resilience, stay focused on their goals, and build healthy habits?

skills.name: Resilience
skills.description: Bloomster's approach to Resilience helps your student develop a growth mindset and the ability to embrace challenges as an opportunity for growth and self-discovery, rather than as a source of fear or anxiety. As a building block to holistic education, resilience is one of the primary determinants of how well your student will thrive in a rapidly changing world.
skills.alert: When met with a challenge, does your student persist through and stay focused on their goals? Or do they easily give up and abandon the idea of achieving what they want by themselves?

skills.name: Fear Management
skills.description: Bloomster's approach to Fear Management equips your student with the tools to acknowledge, understand, and conquer fears, fostering emotional resilience, confident decision-making, and personal growth. As a building block to holistic education, managing fear is one of the primary determinants of how well your student will thrive in a rapidly changing world.
skills.alert: Do you think fear or anxiety is holding your student back from experiencing life to the fullest extent? What other skills could they be lacking because fear is keeping them from vital experiences?

dimensions.alert: How well does your student regulate their emotions? Are they typically self-aware of their impact on others?

dimensions.name: Mindfulness
dimensions.description: Bloomster's approach to education in the Spiritual Dimension explores skills such as Gratitude, Mindfulness, and Meditation. By developing their spiritual awareness, your student can connect with their purpose, learn to think and act mindfully, and cultivate gratitude to cope better with life's stresses and safeguard their mental health.

skills.name: Meditation
skills.description: Bloomster's approach to Meditation helps your student foster inner peace and a deep connection to one's thoughts and emotions. Meditation promotes a sense of harmony and interconnectedness within themself and with the world around them. Your student gains valuable lessons in self-awareness, mindfulness, and self-regulation in addition to developing a strong foundation for meditation.
skills.alert: How might nurturing inner stillness empower your student's lifelong well-being?

activities.name: Releasing Stress and Tension with Meditation

skills.name: Forgiveness
skills.description: Bloomster's approach to Forgiveness empowers your student to release burdens, cultivate empathy, heal relationships, and nurture emotional well-being, fostering a harmonious and compassionate worldview. As a building block to holistic education, forgiveness is one of the primary determinants of how well your student will thrive in their relationships, especially during times of conflict.
skills.alert: How has your student's education in forgiveness influenced their empathy and relationships with others?

skills.name: Mindfulness
skills.description: Bloomster's approach to Mindfulness helps develop present-moment awareness, inner calm, practical mindfulness techniques, as well as a deeper understanding of one's thoughts and emotions. Mindfulness builds on and helps develop self-awareness and empathy, allowing your student to become a conscious and compassionate person who is a positive influence to others.
skills.alert: In challenging or stressful situations, how does your student incorporate mindfulness to stay centered?

activities.name: Social Awareness in making diverse choices

skills.name: Compassion
skills.description: Bloomster's approach to Compassion helps your student nurture their empathy, kindness, and understanding to elevate their overall sense of community. As a building block to holistic education, compassion goes hand in hand with concepts such as forgiveness and interconnectedness to make your student aware of the way their actions impact their world.
skills.alert: Does your student show an understanding of the impact of compassion on building positive relationships? Who have you seen them demonstrate compassion to?

skills.name: Gratitude
skills.description: Bloomster's approach to Gratitude fosters a positive and appreciative mindset, enhancing overall mental health. Students are encouraged to create their own unique gratitude ritual and examine the benefits of practicing gratefulness. Gratitude is a building block for resilience and for your student to become an appreciative individual, capable of seeing more good in the world.
skills.alert: How has nurturing gratitude in your student's education enriched their perspective and emotional well-being?

dimensions.alert: How can guiding your student's spiritual growth inspire purpose, compassion, and be in tune with their body?

dimensions.name: Intellectual
dimensions.description: Bloomster's approach to education in the Intellectual Dimension explores skills such as Critical Thinking, Creativity, Math, English, Finance, and Technology. The development of the intellectual dimension cultivates critical thinking, problem solving, and analytical skills, empowering your student to excel academically, adapt in a changing world, and contribute innovatively.

skills.name: Problem Solving
skills.description: Bloomster's approach to Problem Solving helps your student identify challenges, brainstorm solutions, and implement thoughtful strategies turning every challenge into a thrilling opportunity. With these skills, your student boosts their ability to deal with failure and break down problems to find solutions, preparing them for real-world challenges.
skills.alert: How does your student apply problem-solving techniques to overcome obstacles or achieve their goals?

skills.name: Learning & Adapting
skills.description: Bloomster's approach to Learning & Adapting helps your student with self-regulation, critical thinking, and resilience, enabling them to absorb new information and pivot when life doesn't go their way. Learning & Adapting is a building block for understanding how to thrive in unexpected situations and processing new information to inform their decisions.
skills.alert: How does your student handle new information or changes to routine? Is their response positive or negative?

activities.name: Adjusting and Adapting to Middle School

skills.name: Art
skills.description: Bloomster's approach to Art helps your student cultivate their creativity, self-expression, critical thinking, and cultural appreciation, nurturing well-rounded individuals with enriched perspectives and communication skills. As part of their holistic growth, your student learns interpretation, creative, and out-of-the-box thinking, while learning about formal artistic techniques.
skills.alert: How has your student's artistic education illuminated their creativity and emotional expression in unique ways?

skills.name: Creativity & Innovation
skills.description: Bloomster's approach to Creativity & Innovation helps your student cultivate their creativity, critical thinking, and confidence to try new things. As part of their holistic growth, your student learns out-of-the-box thinking, turning ideas into action, and the resilience to keep trying when ideas don't work.
skills.alert: Does your student show open curiosity about things around them? Do they share new ideas or suggest new ways to do things?

skills.name: Critical Thinking
skills.description: Bloomster's approach to Critical Thinking promotes a “Yes, and” thought process that prepares your student to navigate the complexities of the world with confidence. While working on critical thinking skills, your student also bolsters their analytical skills, collaborative argumentation, and problem-solving abilities.
skills.alert: How comfortable is your student questioning and challenging ideas? Do they seek to understand the underlying reason?

skills.name: Music
skills.description: Bloomster's approach to Music cultivates your student's creativity, enhances cognitive skills, and ability to voice their feelings, and nurtures discipline, leading to holistic personal development and enriched cultural appreciation. Music is a building block for artistic expression, emotional processing, and your student becoming a creative, multifaceted individual.
skills.alert: How has your student's musical education enriched their self-expression and ability to achieve goals?

skills.name: Technology
skills.description: Bloomster's approach to Technology equips your student with digital literacy, innovation, and problem-solving abilities, enabling them to thrive in an increasingly AI and tech-driven world. As a building block to holistic education, being fluent in technology is one of the primary determinants of how well your student will adapt and thrive to whatever the future may hold.
skills.alert: How has your student's exploration of technology shaped their innovative spirit and future aspirations?

skills.name: Finance
skills.description: Bloomster's approach to Finance empowers your student with crucial life skills - budgeting, saving, investing, and responsible financial decision-making, paving the way for future financial stability and success. In addition to helping your student transition seamlessly from childhood to adulthood, financial literacy is a key differentiator in an increasingly entrepreneurial world.
skills.alert: In what ways has your student's financial education kindled their path to a secure and mindful future?

activities.name: Spend, Spend, Spend - but do it wisely!
What IS money and why should I care?
Managing your money responsibly and ethically
Making your money work for you

skills.name: Math
skills.description: Bloomster's approach to Math develops precision, attention to detail, and perseverance. It can help your student foster abilities like interpreting data and solving complex problems. As a building block to holistic education, an understanding of math helps your student think analytically, be more organized, and make sense in a rapidly changing world.
skills.alert: Have you noticed any difficulties or frustrations your student experiences when working with numbers and arithmetic?

activities.name: GCF and LCM Real World Applications
Solving equations with square and cube roots

skills.name: English
skills.description: Bloomster's approach to English Language Arts helps your student with effective communication, critical thinking, cultural appreciation, and literary exploration, enabling them to thrive in a globalized world. With an understanding of English, a student can grasp nuanced concepts in the written and spoken word, utilizing information to gain insight and perspective and communicate more effectively.
skills.alert: In what ways has your student's engagement with English Language Arts enriched their communication and creative growth?

activities.name: Unveiling Central Ideas in Informational Texts
Unveiling Central Ideas in Informational Texts

skills.name: Social Studies
skills.description: Bloomster's approach to Social Studies helps your student to comprehend diverse cultures, historical contexts, and societal structures, fostering empathy, critical thinking and informed citizenship for a globally connected world. Your student gains valuable lessons in social & cultural awareness, compassion, and self-awareness in addition to gaining historical knowledge.
skills.alert: How has your student's engagement with social studies cultivated their empathy and understanding of the world?

skills.name: Science
skills.description: Bloomster's approach to Science encourages your student to question, explore, and comprehend the natural world, fostering critical thinking, curiosity, and innovative problem-solving skills for lifelong learning. Science is a building block for analytical thinking and problem-solving, and your student becoming an inquisitive, multi-faceted individual capable of forging their future.
skills.alert: How has your student's scientific education influenced their curiosity and connection to the natural world?

dimensions.alert: Does your student demonstrate critical thinking and complex problem solving? Could your student benefit from skills in finance, technology, and other academic support?

dimensions.name: Physical
dimensions.description: Bloomster's approach to education in the Physical Dimension explores skills such as Yoga, Physical Fitness, and Health & Nutrition. The development of the physical dimension supports your student in achieving their physical growth milestones, developing healthy habits, boosting attention and memory, and improving their long-term health.

skills.name: Health & Nutrition
skills.description: Bloomster's approach to Health & Nutrition helps your student build good eating habits and develop a healthy relationship with food. Your student will learn about nutrition, how to read food labels, discerning facts from fiction, reducing food waste, and eating for a healthier mind, body, and planet.
skills.alert: How has your student's education in health and nutrition inspired lasting well-being and mindful choices?

skills.name: Yoga
skills.description: Bloomster's approach to Yoga includes the five primary skills of yoga - promoting physical health, emotional well-being, mindfulness, self-awareness, and positive values. By including yoga in their routine, your student gains physical strength and flexibility and learns what it means to be present in their body, finding balance and calm in the moment.
skills.alert: How has your student's engagement in yoga enriched their sense of inner balance and well-being?

courses.name: Breathwork to Awaken Your Super Energy

activities.name: Breath Work for a Calm Clear Mind
Boost Energy and Enthusiasm with Breath

skills.name: Physical Fitness
skills.description: Bloomster's approach to Physical Fitness empowers your student to cultivate lifelong habits of health, enhancing physical well-being, mental clarity, self-discipline, and a resilient foundation for overall success and happiness. Your student gains valuable lessons in body movement, physical science, and setting realistic goals for physical achievement.
skills.alert: In what ways has your student's pursuit of physical fitness empowered their body, mind, and character?

activities.name: What are benchmarks or baseline abilities?

skills.name: Sports
skills.description: Bloomster's approach to Sports fosters physical fitness, teamwork, discipline, and resilience, enabling your student to excel in sports, embrace a healthy lifestyle, and develop life skills. Your student gains valuable lessons in teamwork & collaboration, physical fitness, and self-confidence in addition to learning about a specific sport.
skills.alert: How has your student's involvement in sports fostered their character, resilience, and life lessons?

skills.name: Gross & Fine Motor Skills
skills.description: Bloomster's approach to Gross & Fine Motor Skills helps develop physical coordination, dexterity, and bodily awareness, laying the groundwork for confident movement, creativity, and academic engagement. With this skill, your student is able to connect with their body better, develop a strong foundation for physical coordination and dexterity, and engage in a range of physical activities.
skills.alert: Do you feel that your student's motor skills have enriched their journey towards self-discovery and confidence or held them back?

dimensions.alert: How has physical education enhanced your student's well-being, confidence, and overall vitality?

dimensions.name: Social
dimensions.description: Bloomster's approach to education in the Social Dimension explores skills such as Effective Communication, Conflict Resolution, and Relationship Management. Growth within the social dimension is vital for your student's success. It encourages them to cooperate and connect with others, resolve conflict, contribute to their communities, and make responsible decisions.

skills.name: Responsible Decision Making
skills.description: Bloomster's approach to Responsible Decision Making helps your student connect with their values, as well as identify risks, and consider the consequences of their choices before they make them. Your student gains valuable lessons in responding instead of reacting, and taking ownership of their actions in addition to developing a strong foundation for ethical decision-making.
skills.alert: In what situations have you seen your student's capacity for thoughtful and ethical choices?

courses.name: Online Safety: Building Knowledgeable Digital Citizens

activities.name: How Decision Making Impacts Yourself and Others
Recovering From Mistakes in Decision Making

skills.name: Effective Communication
skills.description: Bloomster's approach to Effective Communication fosters confident expression, active listening, and empathy in your student. Communication takes place digitally and in the real world, and as a building block to holistic education, your student's ability to communicate effectively is one of the primary determinants of how well they will thrive in a rapidly changing world.
skills.alert: Do you feel that your student knows how to express what they really mean to say or do they often have things they say "come out wrong"?

skills.name: Conflict Resolution
skills.description: Bloomster's approach to Conflict Resolution helps your student identify different types of conflict they may come across and navigate these conflicts with confidence and compassion. Your student gains valuable lessons in effective communication as well as teamwork and collaboration in addition to developing a strong foundation for using conflict to create progress.
skills.alert: What is your student's current response to conflict? Does that response help them approach conflict in a healthy way?

skills.name: Empathy
skills.description: Bloomster's approach to Empathy helps your student understand what empathy is and why it is necessary for our world to thrive. Your student learns how to be an empathetic friend, family member, and citizen. Additionally, they boost their awareness about the world around them, the power of empathy, and ways to help those in need, preparing them for real-world challenges.
skills.alert: In what ways does your student empathize with others? Do they empathize with those they don't know?

skills.name: Teamwork & Collaboration
skills.description: Bloomster's approach to Teamwork & Collaboration involves a breakdown of what it means to work with others, what can be gained from diverse perspectives, and how to balance listening with contributing. As part of their holistic growth, your student learns how to communicate effectively with collaborators and the role empathy plays when working with others or leading a team.
skills.alert: Is your student good at sharing? How well do they show up as a team player?

skills.name: Social & Cultural Awareness
skills.description: Bloomster's approach to Social & Cultural Awareness helps your student navigate social complexities with compassion, appreciate diversity, promote inclusivity, and foster positive change. Your student boosts their empathy, compassion, open-mindedness, and their ability to connect the dots and think critically, preparing them for real-world social & cultural challenges.
skills.alert: How does your student express their response to diverse perspectives and cultures?

activities.name: Introduction to Social and Cultural Awareness

skills.name: Relationship Management
skills.description: Bloomster's approach to Relationship Management develops the muscle to navigate conflicts, understand diverse perspectives, and maintain healthy connections with others. As part of their holistic growth, your student learns effective communication, self-awareness, and conflict resolution and how they influence relationship management.
skills.alert: Are you worried about the opportunities your student may miss without strong relationship management skills?

skills.name: Leadership
skills.description: Bloomster's approach to Leadership instills lessons on how to inspire others, nurturing their strengths and abilities in pursuit of a common goal. Without this skill, your student will struggle to have their voice heard or take charge and guide others when they are needed. By nurturing leadership skills, your student will gain confidence, social skills, and practice effective communication.
skills.alert: Does your student need encouragement or are they naturally inclined to take charge?

dimensions.alert: How can fostering strong social skills empower your student's ability to connect with others?

courses.name: Online Safety: Building Knowledgeable Digital Citizens
courses.description: With devices more prevalent than ever, being digitally responsible is more critical than ever. This introductory course helps students build the skills and knowledge to identify and manage digital risks and responsibilities and understand what balanced media looks like. This course educates students about online risks (e.g. phishing, malware and hacking); reviews social media so users can protect privacy; explains how to avoid catfishing; and prevent cyberbullying. Students will also explore how to distinguish the difference between real and fake content.

activities.name: Social Media Safety
activities.description: Social media is widely used by people of all ages. It's a great way to connect with others and stay in touch. But social media has its risks as well. This section will teach students about the benefits and risks of social media so that they can use apps and tools responsibly and safely.

activities.name: Device Responsibility
activities.description: Most children and adults have at least one device, if not more. But how can we use our devices responsibly? This section educates children on responsible device use, helping them to consider the risks and benefits of screen time.

activities.name: Online Risks
activities.description: This section teaches students about common threats online to their devices and personal information. Students will learn about phishing, malware and hacking in detail. This section also teaches students how to protect their computers and how to make a strong password.

activities.name: Digital Literacy
activities.description: This section teaches students about how to think critically about what they read and see online. Students are taught about disinformation and misinformation, with key tips on how to spot each, in order to avoid the consequences of false information online. This section also covers how to react to breaking news and whether or not to trust influencers. Upon completion of the course, students should have skills and tools to critically assess what they see online to make informed decisions about what is true and false.

provider.name: Kerry Wadsley
provider.aboutMe:
Following a degree in Elementary Education at Penn State (USA), I taught at The Elms School, UK for over 10 years, teaching students from 0-11 years. I taught in Key Stage 2 as well as being the Special Educational Needs Coordinator at the school. In 2016, I gained a Master’s in Education from the University of Nottingham (UK). My passion lies in helping students to achieve their potential and eliminating any barriers to learning.
 
I now run my own business as an Educational Consultant, creating curriculum for schools and educational companies around the world. As a former Division I lacrosse player at Penn State (USA), I love exercise and sports and have taught Physical Education in schools for over 10 years. I love being a part of a team and working towards a common goal.
provider.quote: Experienced Elementary Teacher and Educational Consultant

courses.oneliner: Build the skills to identify and manage digital risks and understand what balanced media looks like.
courses.outcome: understands how to use social media and online content responsibly!
courses.collabEmail:
• Check in with your child to make sure that they are completing course exercises. Ask them to explain to you what the course or section is about.
  • Ask your child about their social media. Have they checked their privacy settings? How can they make sure they are being safe on social media?
  • Ask your child to check their own devices are up to date with software and apps.
  • Create a family device plan together as a family.
  • Look at different websites or social media posts together with your child. Try to decide what is real news and what is fake online together.
courses.tags: Online Bullying,Cybersecurity,Online Privacy,Phishing,Malware,Hacking,Digital Responsibility,Managing Online Risks,Internet Safety,Good Decision Making,Hacking,Making Good Decisions,Identifying Threats,Online Safety,Responsibility,Life Skills,Online Dangers,Safety,Online,Technology,Digital Skills,Personal Safety

courses.name: Communication Foundations
courses.description: Grab your hiking boots and trail mix! Franki, a young nature enthusiast, is ready to navigate the world of communication. This course offers learners an opportunity to understand different types of communication and how certain settings require specific skills. Additionally, as learners accompany Franki on his adventure, they’ll meet a variety of people who will help him explore the impact of communication, the significance of empathy and assertiveness, as well as how to navigate communication challenges. Finally, since Franki is a digital native, he and his fellow learners will also have a chance to enhance their understanding of virtual communication. Let’s climb!

activities.name: Effective Communication Essentials
activities.description: In this section, learners will take a tour through the world of effective communication and its connection to self-confidence, social skills, empathy, and assertiveness. Our main character, Franki, will prepare for a family camping trip and make plans that will allow him to become a better verbal, nonverbal, written, and digital communicator. This section will also help learners reflect on their own experiences so that they can advance skills that they will need all their lives at home, at school, in their communities, and someday in the workplace.

activities.name: Digital Citizenship and Communication
activities.description: This section is all about digital citizenship and online communication. The virtual world has become a major part of our everyday lives. Younger generations will never know life without smart devices. The current generation is filled with digital natives who use smart devices frequently, so it’s important to understand rules and standards for communication. With help from reliable sources and experienced users, new users can become more educated about appropriate online conduct.

activities.name: Language and Communication
activities.description: In this section, learners will explore the relationship between language and tone and how the two work. Exercising flexibility in language and tone is important in promoting self-confidence, social skills, empathy, and assertiveness. Our main character, Franki, will engage in and reflect on experiences that further his skills. This section will help learners comprehend how different people and situations require effective communicators to adapt and respond appropriately.

activities.name: Communication Challenges
activities.description: A communication challenge is any difficulty or obstacle that causes a breakdown between individuals or groups who are interacting. Sometimes there can be a barrier that prevents people from communicating effectively. This can lead to misunderstandings, misinterpretations, or confusion. In this section you will learn communication challenges can happen due to differences in language, emotions, or communication skills and how to address them.

provider.name: Ashley Valentine
provider.aboutMe: Ashley is an energetic and creative teacher from the United States who has committed her career to facilitating engaging and unique experiences for learners. She has presented at technology conferences, attended international learning summits, and is deeply passionate about ensuring that learning is both fun and meaningful. She has incorporated escape rooms, social media, experiential learning models, and hands-on techniques to engage Generation Z and prepare for Generation Alpha. An avid learner herself, Ashley holds two degrees in education and engages regularly in professional development so that she can build upon strategies and be responsive to student needs.
provider.quote: Experienced and passionate educator who loves to create memorable, engaging, and diverse learning experiences for all students.

courses.oneliner: Understand different types of communication and how certain settings require specific skills.
courses.support:
• Talk with your child about the importance and goal of their participation in this learning.

  • Encourage your child to be a mindful learner who paces their learning to include reflection.

  • Express the significance of good communication skills now and in the future.

  • Engage your child in reflective conversations about why Franki, the main character, wants to become an expert communicator.

  • Reflect with your child on the similarities that exist between them and Franki, the main character's efforts and thinking.
courses.collabEmail:
• Talk with your child about the importance of participating in this course.
  • Encourage your child to limit distractions, but to take breaks as necessary.
  • Reflect with your child on the similarities that exist between them and Franki, the main character.
  • Self Reflection: Consider your life experiences at your child's age. With relation to communication, where did you excel? What was challenging? Consider your written and verbal/ interpersonal communication.
  • Conversation Starter: Ask questions such as: Which events in the story have made you think the most so far? What do you think will happen next? Where do you see yourself as similar to or different from the main character?
courses.collabScreen:
• Consider your life experiences at your child's age. With relation to communication, where did you excel? What was challenging? Consider your written and verbal/interpersonal communication.
  • Identify a specific point in your life when you began to recognize the importance of strong communication skills? Why is this memorable for you?
  • Reflect on influential leaders or mentors in your own life as you learned to develop your communication skills. Who guided you? How did they help you? Who were your role models? Why?

courses.name: Identifying and Managing Bullies
courses.description: Eighth grader Alexandra is passionate about creating a safe, inclusive environment and promoting respect and empathy among her peers. This will only happen once she and her classmates can identify common forms of bullying, understand the dynamics that contribute to bullying and learn the impact of bullying. Your child can take this journey with Alexandra and develop strategies for intervention and advocacy.

activities.name: Taking Action
activities.description: In this section, participants will join Alexandra and her classmates as they become advocates for a bully-free world both online and in-person. Discussions and examples guide learners in promoting kindness, inclusion, and respect. Topics include advocacy strategies against cyberbullying and getting help for those who experience bullying. The section concludes with a kindness challenge, where participants will create a plan to commit to spreading kindness in their own communities. Empowering students to be proactive agents of change, this section instills practical skills for addressing bullying in various environments, reinforcing the importance to the collective efforts in building a bully-free world.

activities.name: Signs of Bullying and Roles
activities.description: In this section, learners work with Alex and her friends to recognize the signs of bullying and explore who is involved in a bullying situation. Through discussions and scenarios, participants will examine the roles of the person who is bullying, the target of bullying, and the bystander. Students will finish this section exploring ways to help. Understanding the behaviors of each of these individuals will equip students with the knowledge and skills needed to intervene in bullying situations.

activities.name: Defining Bullying
activities.description: In this section, learners dive into the issue of bullying led by the main character, Alexandra. Through discussions, she guides four classmates in preparing a presentation for National Bullying Month. The students define bullying, explore the various types of bullying, and touch on the prevalent issue of cyberbullying. Understanding what constitutes bullying equips all participants with the fundamental skills to identify such behaviors in themselves and others.

activities.name: Bullying Impacts Everyone
activities.description: In this section, learners join Alex and friends on a journey to explore the impacts of bullying. Through discussion and scenarios, participants will dive into the experiences of the target, bystander, and person who bullies. Learners will gain insights into the struggles faced by those directly and indirectly involved. Additionally, this section addresses legal aspects, informing students of their rights in bullying situations. This section fosters empathy, awareness, and empowerment, equipping participants to advocate for a bully-free world.

provider.name: Chelsey Juenemann
provider.aboutMe: Chelsey, a seasoned and adaptable educator, has dedicated two decades to creating interesting and diverse learning environments. She has mainly taught middle school English Language Arts but has experience with all subjects and grade levels. In 2023, she shifted from traditional classrooms to remote teaching, using her education skills to craft innovative learning experiences for students across the United States. Armed with two degrees, including a masters in instructional technology, Chelsey is committed to staying at the forefront of educational advancements. Her passion for technology integrations and versatile teaching methods makes her a dedicated and knowledgeable educator.
provider.quote: Accomplished and enthusiastic educator, dedicated to crafting dynamic, inclusive, and tech-infused learning adventures for every student

courses.oneliner: Examine dynamics that contribute to bullying and learn the impact of bullying.
courses.outcome: can demonstrate strategies for intervention and advocacy!
courses.sensitivecontent:
• The course addresses traumatic experiences including bullying, self-harm, and thoughts of suicide. It also explores potential targets based on race, religion, disability, and sexual orientation. Discussions could be triggering for some children.
  • All topics are age-appropriate, though mature discussions may occur. Parents are advised to familiarize themselves with the content and provide resources to address their child's questions.
  • If your child is under mental health care, discuss taking this course with their professional beforehand. It complements trauma-focused therapy, and keeping the provider informed about the start and progress is crucial for optimal support.
  • Reporting methods will be introduced, including anonymous reporting on social media and the 988 Suicide & Crisis Lifeline. Parents are advised to familiarize themselves with these services and discuss their appropriate use with their child.
  • Given the sensitive topics, be prepared for potential emotional responses. It is recommended to have mental health resources available for additional support or guidance during and after the course.
courses.collabEmail:
• Talk with your child about the importance of participating in this course and learning about bullying prevention.
  • Ask your child if they have ever participated in bullying behaviors. Don't judge. Make a safe space for your child to honestly tell you their story. Then discuss why they did what they did. Discuss ways to prevent the situation from happening again.
  • Ask your child if they have ever been bullied. Give them space to talk about their feelings.
  • Self-Reflection: Reflect on adult experiences with bullying. If involved, consider ways you can change your behaviors. As an observer, were you an upstander or a bystander? Explore ways to advocate for inclusivity, kindness, and respect in these situations as an adult.
  • Activity: Join your child in the Kindness Challenge. With your child, brainstorm ways to spread kindness as family and take on one of the challenges. Take time to reflect together on the impact of your mission.
courses.tags: Bullying,Handling a Bully,Stopping a Bully,Respect,Why do People Bully Others?,Self-Advocacy,Peer Pressure,Conflict Resolution,Considering Others,Online Bullying

courses.name: MindCraft: Developing Analytical Skills
courses.description: Welcome to a transformative journey for your child! This course cultivates open-mindedness, nurtures investigative questioning, and promotes analytical thinking akin to a detective. Your child will learn to ask incisive questions and comprehend the broader implications of concepts. With practice, they can become proficient thinkers. Ready to empower your child's mind and enhance their future prospects? Let's help them learn critical thinking!

activities.name: Assembling Your Analytical Skills
activities.description: Welcome to 'Assembling Your Analytical Skills' - your toolkit to rally the thinking world! Diving deep into analytical thinking is the main focus in this course. But, we will also explore problem-solving skills. Built on the foundation of our previous sections, this section takes your critical thinking abilities up another notch. Ready to analyze your way to success?

activities.name: Crafting an Open Mind
activities.description: Venture into 'Crafting an Open Mind' and boost your thinking skills! This section puts the spotlight on embracing open-mindedness and understanding your own biases. We will also talk about how to ask good questions and listen for responses that might not be accurate. As a sequel to Section 1 on, 'Building Blocks For Smart Thinking!', this is your next step in the critical thinking journey. Elevate your thought process today!

activities.name: Building Blocks for Smart Thinking
activities.description: In this exciting section, kickstart your journey with 'Building Blocks for Smart Thinking!' Dive into the core of critical thinking, unlock its secrets, and master skills like open-mindedness, sharp questioning, and powerhouse analytics. Get ready to transform everyday thoughts into supercharged brainpower!

activities.name: Building Great Questions
activities.description: Step into 'Building Great Questions' and take your thinking to new levels! Hone your questioning skills to a razor-sharp edge while also learning more about brainstorming, having an open-mind, and spotting outliers, and working with others in a group. You'll boost your evaluation and communication skills too! Following our previous sections, this section adds a new dimension to your critical thinking journey. Ready to shape amazing questions?

provider.name: Jim Dolson
provider.aboutMe:
Dr. Jim Dolson, EdD, is an accomplished business leader deeply devoted to education at all age levels. With extensive experience across diverse industries and unwavering dedication to teaching, he is the ideal candidate to develop an outstanding curriculum tailored to middle-school students.

As a parent himself, Dr. Dolson understands at a personal level the significance of engaging and impactful learning experiences. His expertise as an instructor at multiple universities highlights his ability to inspire minds and bring out their full potential.

Driven by a genuine passion for education, Dr. Dolson excels at creating a well-rounded curriculum that challenges and nurtures students' growth. His successful tenure as a K12 Superintendent reflects his commitment to fostering confident and academically empowered individuals.

Families can trust Dr. Dolson’s expertise to provide an exceptional educational journey for students, ensuring they receive the best possible learning experience that prepares them for a successful future.
provider.quote: Experienced Leader & Educator: Crafting Exceptional Curriculum with Dedication

courses.oneliner: Cultivates open-mindedness, nurtures investigative questioning, and promotes analytical thinking.
courses.outcome: is asking incisive questions and considering the broader implications of concepts!
courses.support:
• Experience-Based Discussions: Use your own life lessons to enrich conversations, reinforcing course concepts, and strengthening your parent-child bond

  • Integrate Real-World Learning: Use daily tasks as teachable moments to complement your child's online academic lessons.

  • Skill Development & Growth: Support your child's learning by exploring decision-making exercises alongside them, fostering an environment for honing critical thinking skills.

  • Open-Mindedness & Asking Questions: Reinforce your child's curiosity by engaging in open dialogues, challenging them to ask insightful questions that expand their horizons.

  • Problem Solving & Outliers: Encourage unconventional thinking by discussing your own experiences in outliers, helping your child approach problem-solving from multiple angles.
courses.collabEmail:
• Reinforce your child's curiosity by engaging in open dialogues, challenging them to ask insightful questions that expand their horizons.
  • Be actively involved in your child's learning.
  • Celebrate the process, reinforcing the idea that the journey is as important as the destination.
  • Conversation Starter: Use daily tasks as teachable moments to complement your child's online learning, enrich conversations, reinforce course concepts and strengthen your parent-child bond
  • Self Reflection: Remember when you changed your opinion due to new information - unexpected gems or curveballs? Recognize how they led you to think differently or solve problems in unconventional ways. Reflect on that to better empathize with your child's journey toward open-mindedness.
courses.collabScreen:
• Skill Development & Growth: Recall a time you had to make a critical decision alone. How did you feel? Your experience can guide your child in honing their critical thinking skills.
  • Open-Mindedness & Asking Questions: Remember when you changed your opinion due to new information? Reflect on that to better empathize with your child's journey toward open-mindedness.
  • Problem Solving & Outliers: Reflect on moments when you encountered outliers—those unexpected gems or curveballs—in your own life. Recognize how they led you to think differently or solve problems in unconventional ways.
